Key Match Events: Anthony Davis scored at least 35 points in his second consecutive game to open the season.
The Lakers clawed back from an early 22-point deficit against the Suns.
Anthony Davis, LeBron James, and Austin Reaves led the charge with Davis scoring 35 points, James finishing with 21 points and 8 assists, and Reaves contributing 26 points, 8 assists, and 3 steals.
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James emphasized the importance of Anthony Davis being the main focal point for the team every night.
Austin Reaves expressed his admiration for Davis' performance, calling it 'unreal' and stating he feels lucky to have him as a teammate.
JJ Redick, the Lakers' coach, credited Davis for his intentional involvement and ability to create mismatches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anthony Davis matched the scoring start of Lakers greats Jerry West and Elgin Baylor, who also had high-scoring starts to their seasons.
JJ Redick is the first Lakers coach since Phil Jackson in 2010-11 to lead the team to a 2-0 start.
